title: Integrate with Webex for SAM
content:
This page describes how to configure integration with Webex to import user entitlement data and license consumption data from Webex. This is part of the SaaS product setup in SAM.

Create an integration in Webex

To integrate with Webex, you need to create an integration in Webex. Perform the following steps:

  1. Log in to the Webex Developer Portal.

  2. Select My Webex Apps from the menu under your avatar at the top of the page.

  3. Click Create a New App, and then click Create an Integration to start the wizard.

  4. Provide some basic information like the integration's name, description, and logo.

  5. Enter https://<Service Management host>/rest/<Service Management tenant Id>/opb/oauth/callback in the Redirect URI field.

  6. Select these scopes: spark-admin:licenses_read, spark-admin:people_read.

  7. Click Add Integration.

Take note of the generated Client ID and Client Secret. You will need to enter them when you configure the Webex endpoint in Service Management.

Prepare an integration user

Prepare an integration user before setting up the integration. For details of how to prepare an integration user, see Prepare an integration user.

Set up the Webex integration in Service Management

To set up the Webex integration for Webex data import, perform the following steps.

Create an endpoint

Create an endpoint using the Rest Executor 2.0 endpoint type:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as the integration administrator.

  2. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints.

  3. Click Add.

  4. Select Rest Executor 2.0 as the endpoint type, enter a name for the endpoint (for example, Webex), and then click Add. The system creates the endpoint.

  5. Click Configure and complete the following fields.

    Field Value
    General configuration
    Agent Select Agentless for a direct connection to the Webex API
    Authentication type Select OAuth 2.0
    Protocol Select https
    Base URL Enter https://webexapis.com
    Certificate type (optional) Select X.509
    Certificate format (optional) Select PEM
    Server certificate

    (optional)

    Open the root CA certificate file of the Webex system in a text editor, and then copy and paste the content to this field. If the content is invalid, an error occurs when you click Save in the next step.

    The certificate content must resemble the following.

    -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----

    

    -----END CERTIFICATE-----
    Enable email notification for token expiration Check this option and configure the Recipients field based on your needs
    Recipients Configure the email notification recipients based on your needs
    Get token configuration
    Grant Type Authorization Code
    Client ID Enter the client Id obtained during the Webex integration creation process.
    Client Secret Enter the client secret obtained during the Webex integration creation process.
    Authorization URL Enter https://webexapis.com/v1/authorize
    Redirect URL Enter https://<Service Management host>/rest/<Service Management tenant Id>/opb/oauth/callback
    Token URL Enter https://webexapis.com/v1/access_token
    Scope Enter spark-admin:licenses_read spark-admin:people_read
    State (Optional) Enter an appropriate value.
    Send client Id and secret Select In body
    Content-Type application/x-www-form-unlencoded

  6. Click Get token and then complete the login and consent process. If your endpoint configuration is correct, you will see the Available status in the Token status section after the process is finished.

  7. Click Save.

Create an integration

In the following steps, you'll create an integration with the predefined template.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click New, enter the name of your integration, and then click Save. The system displays the Integration page.
  3. In the Details section, configure the integration user you created for the current Service Management system and activate the integration.
  4. In the Connector-Endpoint mappings section, click Add to add a mapping.
  5. Select REST API (under Webex) as the connector, select the Webex endpoint that you created earlier, and then enter an alias for the mapping.
  6. Click Save.

Add the scenario

Perform the following steps to add a scenario to the integration:

  1. Click Add scenario.

  2. Enter a name for the scenario. For example, "Import Webex user entitlements".

  3. In the Template field, select SAM - Import Webex user entitlement (under Webex REST API).

    • Using the out-of-the-box template simplifies integration configuration compared to starting from scratch. If you choose not to use this option, you'll need to manually build your logic from a blank page.
    • You can update the APIVersion key in the template based on your business requirements.
  4. Click Save to add the scenario. 
  5. Follow the above steps again to add the "Import Webex license consumption" scenario; select the SAM - Import Webex license consumption template this time.

Next steps

Complete the remaining steps of the SaaS product configuration process:

  • Create and configure the Webex product in SAM
  • Create license metrics (if necessary)
  • Create licenses for services included in Webex (if necessary)
  • Verify the Webex integration
  • Verify the details of the license models for Webex services
  • Schedule the periodic triggering of the integration
